abstracts.cdata!:
The Lifelong Learning Project aims at
            supporting the Government of Argentina to consolidate,
            strengthen, and increase the coverage of a lifelong learning
            and competency-based training system for disadvantaged
            adults 18 years or older with the objectives for those who
            participate to: (i) enhance employability (for unemployed);
            and (ii) improve career opportunities (for employed). The
            reallocation is necessary because the Borrower has claimed
            reimbursements for almost 100 percent of category 7. The
            initial amount assigned to category 7 was conservative as
            the youth employment program was new and its pace of
            implementation was uncertain. Progress on installation of
            the program is in line with the expectations set out in the
            project appraisal document (PAD). The reallocation requested
            by the Borrower represents only 10 percent of total project
            costs and will not affect the satisfactory performance on
            the achievement of the project's development
            objectives. The expenditure categories financing output
            based activities are unchanged. Since the Ministry of Labor
            is managing the project through its existing structure fewer
            consultants have been hired than expected. In addition, in
            the case of some expenditures (operating costs, equipment,
            and educational materials), the Ministry of Labor has
            decided to use local resources.
